intro: Apinagia fucoides, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers and feathery leaves, which are often mistaken for those of other members of the carrot family. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its salt-tolerant properties. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of stems, creating a striking visual display. Apinagia fucoides is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
